title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says the low-pressure area over the southwest Bay of Bengal is very likely to continue to move west-northwestwards slowly, towards the Tamil Nadu coast close to Northern Sri Lanka during the next 24 hours.

title: WhatsApp and Instagram restored after Meta outages
byline: Instagram and WhatsApp are now back online after a mass global outage affected several Meta-owned apps on Wednesday.

title: UN General Assembly demands ceasefire in Gaza and backs UN agency helping Palestinian refugees
byline: The U.N. General Assembly overwhelmingly approved resolutions Wednesday demanding an immediate ceasefire in Gaza and backing the U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees that Israel has moved to ban.

title: 10-yr-old girl dies, 3 injured in accident on Expressway
byline: Three individuals from the same family have been injured and a young girl has died in a fatal accident that occurred near the Pinnaduwa interchange on the Southern Expressway.

title: Imported rice stocks released to market
byline: Stocks of rice imported by private importers have been released into the market.

title: Petition against CC rejecting Ranil’s nominee for SC judge dismissed
byline: The Supreme Court today dismissed a petition submitted by a lawyer, which claimed that his fundamental rights were violated by the Constitutional Council’s rejection of a proposal made by then-President Ranil Wickremesinghe to appoint Appeals Court Chairman Nissanka Bandula Karunaratne as a Supreme Court Judge.

title: Govt. decides on compensation for farmers for crop damage
byline: Deputy Minister of Agriculture and Livestock, Namal Karunaratne, says that necessary steps will be taken to provide full compensation of Rs. 100,000 per hectare to farmers whose crops were destroyed due to recent adverse weather conditions.

title: Leptospirosis identified as cause of 7 deaths in North
byline: Following tests on multiple samples, the fever which spread in the northern region of the island and claimed 7 lives, has been identified as Leptospirosis, also known as ‘rat fever’, the Epidemiology Unit of the Ministry of Health confirmed.

title: Court issues injunction order over SJB’s National List
byline: The Colombo District Court today issued a restraining order preventing the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) from submitting their National List without including the name of Nizam Kariapper of the Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC).

title: SC rules Azath Salley’s arrest under PTA unlawful
byline: The Supreme Court has ruled that the arrest and detention of the former Governor of Western Province Azath Salley, under the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) in 2021 was illegal.

title: SJB announces its National List MPs
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has finally announced the four names nominated to fill its remaining National List MP seats in Parliament.

title: Woman arrested for soliciting Rs. 350,000 bribe
byline: A woman from Thalathuoya has been arrested by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) for allegedly soliciting a bribe of Rs 350,000.

title: ASPI crosses 14,000 points for first time ever
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange recorded a new all-time high today (12), surpassing the 14,000 mark for the first time in history.

title: Samsung accuses India antitrust body of detaining employees, seizing data unlawfully
byline: Samsung has accused India’s competition watchdog of unlawfully detaining its employees and seizing data in a raid carried out in connection with an antitrust investigation on Amazon and Walmart’s Flipkart, a legal filing shows.

title: Queensland to impose adult prison sentences on children
byline: The Australian state of Queensland has passed laws which will see children as young as 10 subject to the same penalties as adults if convicted of crimes such as murder, serious assault and break-ins.

title: Sri Lanka receives 55,000 MT of MOP fertilizer under World Food Programme
byline: A donation of 55,000 metric tonnes of Muriate of Potash (MOP) fertilizer, also known as ‘Bandi Pohora,’ has been handed over to the Government of Sri Lanka today (12) under the World Food Programme (WFP).

title: Biden commutes roughly 1,500 sentences and pardons 39 people in biggest single-day act of clemency
byline: President Joe Biden is commuting the sentences of roughly 1,500 people who were released from prison and placed on home confinement during the coronavirus pandemic and is pardoning 39 Americans convicted of nonviolent crimes. It’s the largest single-day act of clemency in modern history.

title: Trump named Time’s ‘Person of the Year’ for second time
byline: Donald Trump once publicly speculated that Time would never name him the news magazine’s “Person of the Year.”

title: 1,900 MT of rice imported by private sector since Dec. 10
byline: Sri Lanka Customs said that the private sector has imported 440 metric tonnes of rice from India since December 09, 2024.

title: President calls for strengthening Sri Lanka’s financial system
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has directed the Ministry of Finance to implement measures to enhance the efficiency and resilience of Sri Lanka’s financial system.

title: Selena Gomez announces engagement to Benny Blanco
byline: Selena Gomez has revealed she is engaged to songwriter Benny Blanco.
